website_summaries.verdict: This dehydrated dog food has free-range chicken, veggies and organic whole grain barley and is higher in calories for more active or pregnant dogs.
pros: Made of minimally processed ingredients, this also comes in turkey and beef, as well as a vegetable base mix that can be added to fresh meat
Dogs  find it appetizing and it works well with those with allergies, even though it's not grain-free
of food or comes in pre-packed cups in a case of 12
cons: Needs to be mixed with water, and some found the pate-like consistency difficult to eat

website_summaries.verdict: You'll have to put in a bit of preparation to get this from the bag to the bowl, but dogs love it and the price is right.
pros: Flavors include Free Range Chicken, Cage Free Turkey, and Range Raised Beef
Sizes range from a Starter Kit to a 10 lb
Some owners claim that dogs on this food have shinier coats, better energy, and more easily maintain a healthy weight
cons: The preparation here - measure food, heat and measure water, wait for it to rehydrate - may put off some owners (and many impatient dogs)
Some reports of the smell and consistency not being that great

customer_reviews.title: Contains sodium selenite
customer_reviews.text: Contains sodium selenite, not shown in the photographed ingredient list and not mentioned until the last list of ingredients in this listing. This listing has more than one ingredient list in the listing and this food additive is not disclosed until the very last ingredient list. Sodium selenite causes a toxic buildup over time in dogs and leads to muscle weakness and pulmonary edema , among other things. The smaller the dog, the quicker the buildup. Be forewarned.
customer_reviews.author: KSTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: my dogs love the food but I have found roaches in three ...
customer_reviews.text: my dogs love the food but I have found roaches in three different orders. they definitely have a roach problem.
customer_reviews.author: sulma a.

customer_reviews.title: Really bad product made my dog sick don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: I think this gave my dog situational diabetes as he lost a huge amount of weight and started wetting the bed with no control. Followed the instructions and had him only on this for 6-8 months and he started eating junk in the yard looking for nutrition and found a blockage. Took him to the vet and $800 later the blockage passed and he’s ok. He wet the bed and had to wear a diaper until I switched him back to NORMAL DOG FOOD and he perked back up and stop wetting the bed. In two months. We were talking $150/mo for pill insulin for my dog. Don’t buy this brand of food until they do better nutrition testing
customer_reviews.author: Halsey

customer_reviews.title: I usually love Honest Kitchen but for some reason this batch of ...
customer_reviews.text: I usually love Honest Kitchen but for some reason this batch of dog food seemed a little off. My poor little dog got sick from each serving so I ended up throwing the entire bag out. I hate wasting food but couldn't handle having my little fur baby being sick. Hopefully this is just a one off issue.
customer_reviews.author: Life Equestrian

customer_reviews.title: Nice company bad food 😐
customer_reviews.text: This food was recommended by our new holistic veterinarian. We were very happy to discover such high quality food for our sweet labradoodle Amelia. We were shocked that Amelia became extremely ill after only four cups span over 3 days. We wanted to ease her into the new food. She acted as if she didn’t feel well Day one and two then day three she began vomiting profusely. The company was very responsive and issued an immediate refund. Amelia is not a dog with a sensitive stomach she is a good eater. Something is very wrong with the food. It could be a bad batch.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Stay away... for now
customer_reviews.text: This USED to be my dog's favorite food, but something with the formula changed. I emailed the manufacturer to state that the last two boxes that I have purchased (one from Amazon and one from a local pet food place) have been different than the previous ones - my dog refuses to eat it. Others have mentioned that their dogs are getting sick from it... If I were you, I'd stay away for now.
customer_reviews.author: IV

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I wanted so badly for our American Cocker Spaniel to be able to eat this to replace dry kibble. However after following the manufacturer's feeding instructions and giving it a couple of weeks and having our dog heave several nasty, hard to clean up messes onto a sofa and a carpet I am giving up. On top of that going this way is considerably more expensive... The box is labeled as to imply it's equivalent to a 40 pound bag of kibble. It is not...it IS ABOUT 40 POUNDS AFTER YOU ADD WATER. But the caloric content is fractional compared to kibble.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Having to sneak it into their original food. :(
customer_reviews.text: I have had to add a small teaspoonful to the dry food (pedigree) that my husband feeds his giant Chocolate lab, I add hot water and then mix it up and let it sit for a few minutes. - It takes all day and they have to be hungry before my 3 Chihuahua's will eat any of it at all. I can not afford to buy something they will not eat, so we will not buy this type again. I will add that we plan to try an all meat brand - if you sell it. I'm just very unhappy with the box that we bought. :(
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn T.

customer_reviews.title: Made In China
customer_reviews.text: False advertising. Label on front say's made in USA. Label inside say's Made In China????? Would not feed foreign food to any animal. Honest Kitchen, talk about a false name.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Soulia

customer_reviews.title: Wish we'd found this food sooner
customer_reviews.text: When our 12 year old Boston terrier was diagnosed with inflamed intestines and a tumor was detected somewhere in his digestive system, our vet recommended this excellent food. Throughout his life, our buddy had food allergies that required us to change food every 6 months, and we had run out of choices. This food helped to reverse his conditions, and he lived another 8 months while on medications. In the end, we bought more time with him, but his quality of life could not be sustained no matter what we could do, but he lived to be 13, and died a happy dog. I'd like to think his food helped to extend his time with us.
customer_reviews.author: Dub32

customer_reviews.title: My Dog LOVES it!
customer_reviews.text: I swear, they must put puppy crack in those boxes! Just the smell of it drives my husky mutt into hysterics. And she licks the bowl spotless, and then comes back to make sure she didn't leave any tiny specks by accident. And after she eats, her breath smells like chicken. I gave some some to my mother-in-law's Jack Russell mutt, and she went crazy for it, too. And this is a dog that never eats kibble when you put it in her bowl, even high quality kibble -- she waits until she's starving. Honest Kitchen is expensive, but you won't regret the quality or your dog's reaction (if they're anything like mine)!
customer_reviews.author: Richard H.

customer_reviews.title: I wanted our dog to love it....but he doesn't
customer_reviews.text: I have a picky 6 month old goldendoodle. It has been really challenging to find a type food that he likes - tried all different types of kibbles, but he just won't eat it unless we mix it with wet or homemade dog food. Rather than buying wet food all the time, I thought we should try this. He won't eat it, unless he goes a long time without food and he's starving. Even then, he'll just nibble. When he does eat it, his breath is unbearable. I probably wouldn't have continued even if he did like it because I can't stand his stinking breath!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Our Dog loves Honest Kitchen Grain Free. He was sick for  2 days with Grains added.
customer_reviews.text: Our vet has been after us to give our diabetic dog to eat grains. We substituted Honest Kitchen grain free for 1/4 of the amount. Our dog has been sick for two days and we can't give insulin. We used 1 cup of the mix. They won't take it back. We are out 47.00 and have a sick diabetic dog. We will stick to our Honest Kitchen grain free food but will buy it locally.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Green mush
customer_reviews.text: My pugs and I aren't sure about this. Reminds me of the movie about soylent green. When you add water to the dry mix it turns into a nasty thick green mush, chicken is negotiable, definitely no chunks or even little pieces visible. Since I feed my dogs chicken anyway, I dipped my chicken in this and gave it to them. They ate it but weren't overwhelmed . Would not even think of giving them this gruel by itself. Probably won't order again
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Honest....Honestly
customer_reviews.text: So it looks like sawdust, but green. I mixed it with water as it said, and it was like a paste. My dogs would have NOTHING to do with it. I have 6 dogs, and two actually threw it right up. I tried mixing it with kibble, other food, like cooked or boiled chicken, to no avail. Perhaps my dogs are just spoiled, but I honestly didn't like the texture at all.
customer_reviews.author: echomillcottage

customer_reviews.title: My dog would go hungry before eating this.
customer_reviews.text: No matter what small amount I added to his home cooked food, he would refuse to eat. I tried very gradual amounts for about a month and ended up dumping his food every day and giving him the food I had cooked if I wanted him to eat.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent customer

customer_reviews.title: Only commercial food my dog can eat
customer_reviews.text: Retired breeder/show winner. I’ve had dogs my entire life and quality food is #1 for me. Avid raw feeder, it’s just not possible at times. Especially if we go on vacation and can’t take the dogs. Dog sitters get inked out feeding raw. I have 4 dogs 2 dobermans, 2 pomeranians. One pom in particular has a very delicate stomach. I tried 5 star rated kibble with no success with her. Non stop diarrhea. Before I fed raw, THK was my go to. So I put her on it, violia no diarrhea! She inhales it.
customer_reviews.author: KMS

customer_reviews.title: Dog refuses to eat this green mushy...
customer_reviews.text: My dog is not a picky eater. He ate it for 2 days and now he refuses to eat this even when he is super hungry☹️
customer_reviews.author: Hazel

customer_reviews.title: Garlic?
customer_reviews.text: My dogs lived this for the first 3 bags but this bag is not going over well and the older dog is having a lot of stomach distress. Why does it have garlic which is poisonous to dogs?
customer_reviews.author: Carol S. Lotz-felix

customer_reviews.title: Rather gross. Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is nasty. When you add water to it, it doesn't become soft or fluid... it gets the consistency of that slime stuff that kids like to play with. Its gross and has a strong herb smell. Dogs wont eat it.
customer_reviews.author: Starla

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: We had our EBD on this food for several weeks. Our dog started eating grass like crazy & then the vomiting started. I returned to this site & read the reviews, which I should have done before giving this to our dog, & believe there’s a good probability these issues were caused by this food. Btw, our dog is almost 7 & has never vomited before in her life. It’s not worth taking the chance. We’ve switched back to her previous dog food. Hopefully, things will improve. If not soon, we’ll have our vet check her.
customer_reviews.author: Mary K.

customer_reviews.title: Healthy Healthy Top Quality
customer_reviews.text: Dog health food in a box. It is amazing all by itself, but for cost effectiveness I mix this with some cooked meat and kibble and my dogs absolutely love it. As a pet parent I feel like this adds so much goodness and nutrition to their diet and it has fiber so keeps them regular which is just as good for dogs as people. I used to have an holistic pet product business and have researched a lot about pet food and nutrition and I can say that the Honest Kitchen is as high quality as it comes and the founders are simply wonderful caring conscientious folks. Can't say a bad word about the company or the product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery Mandrake

customer_reviews.title: Dogs throwing up
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 dogs. 3 of them are throwing up after eating this. It (and now my dogs) have a strong garlic smell and the consistency is quite gluey - even with a lot of water. Another minus - their stool is enormous. I can't recommend this food.
customer_reviews.author: SnR

customer_reviews.title: Senior dog loves it, licks the bowl clean
customer_reviews.text: After 13 years of feeding my dog regular and Rx kibble, my vet suggested this product as my dog was often throwing up or having the runs. He also wouldn't always eat his food without adding some chicken. After gradually introducing this to his diet, my dog loved it. He laps it right up, and licks the bowl clean. It probably doesn't hurt that I heat it up (helps to reconstitute). It may look funny, but it's most important that he likes it. His poops even seem to smell less. I feel good that I am feeding him ingredients that I can understand and don't look like filler. I recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: HarV eye

customer_reviews.title: Sounded great but not for my dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog lost all his fur along his back and his skin started peeling off in big dry flakes when we switched him to this food. I'm hoping it's just the grains but waiting on further test results from his vet to see what happened. I'm hoping it's only our dog this happens to. He did absolutely love the taste and still goes crazy if he walks by the shelf where the box is but he's definitely allergic to something in it. I'd like to try a grain free version but it's so costly and I cant afford to throw away another $25 or more for nothing. Read the ingredients before you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pet food
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t ask for a better food! I ordered once and my package was stolen. I had a friend who was using this food and she provided me some until my new one arrived! Within 3-4 days, I’ve noticed my dog had a healthier looking coat, his bowel movements were more normal and a better consistency and I am completely in love with the dehydrated content and process of this product. I also love that it’s made in the USA, comes in 3 flavors and I’m looking forward to more flavors in the future, like salmon, bison, deer etc. I have a doodle and this has been perfect for him now for 10 days total and I’m a customer ❤️
customer_reviews.author: Nikki delgado

customer_reviews.title: Possible allergic reaction to the chicken, not the beef - start with the SMALL box
customer_reviews.text: We use the beef version which my 8yo great dane loves. I decided to try chicken b/c I know she loves chicken and it's $10 cheaper per box. After just a couple feedings, her feet were swelling and she had some skin issues. We kept going for another couple days and she was worse. We switched back to beef for the last two feedings and she's already doing better. It appears she has an allergy to something in the chicken version. So we have an open $60 box of food she cannot eat :( I wish I had started with the smaller box and that is my recommendation. It costs more per serving but start small.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.G

customer_reviews.title: Looks weird, works well
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical when I first mixed this up for my two dogs. Green, sticky and looked like vomit but smelled of fresh cooked chicken and peas. I'm not going to lie, I almost ate some. Dogs seemed to feel the same way as they sniffed and smelled until they finally got used to the texture. This is my second bag and dogs like it so far and that is coming from two VERY picky eaters, a chocolate lab mix and a blue nose terrier. Also, very easy to add in medications, joint supplements, etc without them knowing. Once I taste this stuff for myself, I'll put a review for "Flavor" on here.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Best quality dog food ever
customer_reviews.text: My family has a Japanese Akita that is the pickiest eater. He would purposely skip meals to avoid eating his dog food and we have tried so many different brands. This brand was recommended by a friend and ever since his first Honest Kitchen meal, he has finished every single bowl of food ever served to him. Super happy that we finally found something that he's happy eating and actually looks forward to eating too. The packaging shows the ingredients and everything looks super clean. Makes you feel good about knowing what you're feeding your fur baby. Love that I can buy this on Amazon too.
customer_reviews.author: K. C.

customer_reviews.title: Has bad ingredients in it.
customer_reviews.text: I returned this as it has an ingredient that is toxic to dogs!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did the formula change THAT much?
customer_reviews.text: I have been feeding my dogs this food forever and in this last batch I've ordered they all got sick. Random puking, their poops are covered in a white slime(sorry the TMI), etc. I've tried contacting the company, with no success. So, I would be aware before buying it in bulk like we did. Now I have 4 or 5 boxes at home and they won't refund me :) YAY.
customer_reviews.author: Tati Fazzio

customer_reviews.title: I am sure there are dogs that like it but still barely any meat
customer_reviews.text: There is definitely not a lot of meat it’s mostly oats and vegetables. My dogs wanted nothing to do with it after the first feeding. I am sure there are dogs that like it but still barely any meat. Very pricey for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: One of my dogs is very picky and won’t eat his dry food all the time. I didn’t want to give him canned food because I read that it’s horribly unhealthy and raw food diets are way too expensive for me. Healthy Kitchen is a great alternative. I feed my dogs dry food in the morning and this at night and he runs top speed to his bowl at dinner time everyday now. The 10 lb box lasts me about a month for 1 meal a day for two dogs, One dog is 25 lbs and the other is 50 lbs. I’ve tried all 3 flavors and my dogs love them all.
customer_reviews.author: Jill D

customer_reviews.title: My dog wouldn’t come near it.?
customer_reviews.text: It wasn’t kibble. It was greenish and looked like alfalfa pellets and oatmeal like stuff. My dog wouldn’t come near it so I tossed it.? Adding meat to it didn’t make it more appealing.
customer_reviews.author: Sondra Gail Adam

customer_reviews.title: Dog wouldn't touch it!
customer_reviews.text: I had previously ordered the chicken without grain and my Giant Schnauzer devoured it, I didn't notice the grain when I ordered 4 boxes and with grain she will not touch it. I do highly recommend the grain free though and would have exchanged the four boxes, but amazon has a no return policy. Order small to test it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Evers

customer_reviews.title: My fussy little poodle cleans the bowl.  She stands on hind feet to supervise mixing this food.
customer_reviews.text: Nice to have something warm to offer the dog. Makes an excellent base to top with fresh meat. I can't judge the scent since I can't smell the dog food, but my dog certainly likes the scent. Very different than other dog foods, and my senior dog who is only supposed to have chicken based protein, finds this a very welcome variant from her other chicken dog food that she gets so bored with. Furthermore, this is a moist dog food without having to deal with a can opener, nor take up so much pantry space.
customer_reviews.author: pat schilling

customer_reviews.title: Dog wouldn't even try it
customer_reviews.text: This made a greenish mush when rehydrated and smelled a little like feces. My would not touch it and my cat, who usually rushes in to eat whatever my dog has left, backed away as well. For me, this was a total waste of money. I literally had to throw it out. I think if you are interested in trying it, maybe try to find a smaller package.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: One of our dogs has some medical issues and we were having issues with the amount of water he drank and overall health from these medical issues. This food has been a perfect fit for him and our needs. had tried several other brands and types of food after lots of research. Honest Kitchen dog food has improved our dogs over all health, weight and other medical issues. This is not proven, but just what improvement we have seen since changing to this food and also another thing we discovered is our dogs are much better with grain in their food, not the grain free.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Delicious mush!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves Honest Kitchen. I mix up the powder, some turmeric powder, and dried parsley with hot water and let that sit. Then I add some chopped carrot, some wet food/meaty kibble as a topper and top everything with a pump of fish oil. My dog is 8 years old, so I have to customize his meal for him, regardless of what I feed. Rehydrated raw allows me greater control over how and what I make for him. Dinners have been Honest kitchen since I adopted him, and we couldn’t be happier! Just wish it went on sale more often.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: A little old lady
customer_reviews.text: I have a very picky 14 year old shihtzu, who was previously eating frozen food. Well since the coronavirus, they haven’t been manufacturing it so I had to find a replacement option for her. I saw this and thought I would give it a try. She whined the entire time I was making it and then ate it like she hadn’t eaten in a week.
customer_reviews.author: Robby Tee

customer_reviews.title: Beef is terrible.
customer_reviews.text: My dog won’t touch the beef. She loves the chicken. This was a total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: HY

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: ive been using this for a hybrid foster dog who is a bag of bones and carries all his anxiety in his stomach...its been a challenge getting his stomach to settle...this food has been wonderful...his butt is finally not explosive...i dont use nearly the amount of water they say to use per cup...he likes his food in a sticky lump but its helped his digestion in a huge way...its expensive...but hes worth it...
customer_reviews.author: highasa sparrow

customer_reviews.title: Good mixer
customer_reviews.text: Our dog gets bored of eating the same thing so we have to mix things up. I don't blame him. I'd get bored eating the same thing all the time, too. 1 tablespoon of this usually does the trick when added to his normal kibble. The minus one star is that the smaller 2lb box doesn't have a resealable bag like the 10lb box does. Since we're constantly switching between the turkey and beef flavors, canned food, and food rolls as mixers... it'd be nice if it had a zip bag to ensure freshness a little longer. Doggo loves it and so far it's the winner of mixers.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Noticeably better for my dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, honestly, I haven't tasted it; but my dog eats it happily, so... But I can say changing to this was a lifesaver. I had a dog with a very sensitive stomach and this was the first food I found that she could eat without rejecting onto my carpet later. Another happy product of using this was that her coat became so soft and luxurious! She is no longer with me, but I have fed my subsequent kids Honest Kitchen because it was so obviously beneficial to her. They have my dogs and I for life.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Are you sure I can't eat this?
customer_reviews.text: I love my dogs. They love the Honest Kitchen. Read the ingredients label. When I prepare a meal for my family I work hard to make it the most nutritious, fresh and tasty food possible. Honest Kitchen does all that for me. No more tin cans and greasy garbage for my canine family. Prep time is a snap. It simply mixes with water and in about as much time as it takes to open a can of traditional dog food/garbage, you have a delicious, nutritious meal for your precious pups. Thank You Honest Kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy K

customer_reviews.title: Most Affordable Way To Feed Raw
customer_reviews.text: Most affordable and healthy way to feed your dog raw food, without the chance of getting your dog sick. Some dog's stomachs are super sensitive to raw diets and this food doesn't affect them like that. My two American Bulldog / Boxer mixes LOVE it too. I do mix it with a tiny bit of dry food (Blue Buffalo and A Taste Of The Wild) so as to keep their teeth clean, plus it makes it last longer. It's such a treat! The fish version smells awful, though. I'd forego that flavor and instead feed them an omega-3 capsule. I feed mine the chicken and they chow down!
customer_reviews.author: CoolLuke

customer_reviews.title: Finally a food my dog likes.
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable. My dog hates all dog food. She refuses to eat any that I have tried. She even refuses to eat food I make for her if she has it more than 3 days in a row. Well she loves this stuff. And her poo has been less messy, and as embarrassing as it is to admit, she sometimes eats her own p**p. Well she has stopped doing that. She has been eating the new food for two weeks now, and I can finally relax. I even bought a box for my sister's dog, who had some while we were on vacation together. She loves it also, and said the same thing about cleaner bowel movements. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Dianne

customer_reviews.title: My Dog goes bonkers for roasted chicken!
customer_reviews.text: This is my dog's favorite food! The first box I bought was the Grain free beef recipe. He ate it but would leave some of it on his plate. I bought the Whole grain chicken and nothing is left on the plate! We will be buying more of the roasted chicken from now on!
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Where's the meat?
customer_reviews.text: I posted a more indepth review on the Turkey flavor, In summary, I have to add meat to this for my two lab mixes to go near it. Even though meat is listed as the first ingredient, there really is not much there. I have tasted it as it is supposed to be human quality, the scent and flavor did not impress me same as it did not impress my dogs. Add I very high price tag, and this was interesting to try, but became a pass in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Don G.

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love this food are excited to eat but there is no resealable bag
customer_reviews.text: My dogs absolutely love this food as an additive to their current regimen. I am giving 4 stars because it wont let me do 1/2 stars because I do not like that the plastic packaging is not resealable and for the price there should be a resealable bag! I have never seen dogs so excited to eat so overall I am happy. The price is a bit high but it is good quality food and am considering adding my cat to this regimen if I can find a smaller portion to try.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly A. Crout

customer_reviews.title: My Frenchie liked it for a little while
customer_reviews.text: My Frenchie had no problems with the green color. He can hardly wait for his dinner. He’s not a picky eater so he had no issue with the texture or color. He didn’t chew dry kibble so he would always get choked and spit whole pieces up hours later. I switched him to canned food about 2 months ago. I found this food online and it seems to be a healthier option. Update: After about a month, my dog lost interest in this food. He would never walk away from his bowl with food still in it but he started doing that with this food. Unfortunately, the food search continues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great. Convenient. They adore it! Win!!!
customer_reviews.text: MY DOGS LOVE THE TURKEY FLAVOR!!! They scarf it up immediately upon setting it down. I have one sort of picky eater and one who would and does it anything, so both adore it. Very convenient to make with warm water, bowl and spoon. I can make some a little ahead and store in fridge in ziplock sandwich bags. Not the cheapest option for pet food but very worth the money for me. My dogs coats have never looked better and seem to be more satiated between meals. You can actually see the potato and carrots in the dry mix.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie H

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate being able to serve warm food to my senior shih tzu and his buddy, the senior chihuahua. Both are missing many teeth and struggle to eat regular kibble. They would always tire of every dog food I tried even those chewier kinds with soft bits. Now they literally run ahead of me to the kitchen for this food and remind me it's time to eat. It's like they're regular dogs or something. Thank you for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: S. Hargrove

customer_reviews.title: Like a homemade diet without all the work
customer_reviews.text: A vet suggested a homemade diet for our 14-1/2 year old lab. She loved it, but it took hours to prepare and freeze. I was making a batch every three days. WAAAY too much time spent cooking and cleaning up after all the ingredients. She suggested trying Honest Kitchen as a replacement. I feed 3/4 kibble with Honest Kitchen mixed in, and my dog loves it. The only reason I gave 4 stars is the cost. I really can't afford to feed her just this, but we're getting the desired results with mixing it with kibble.
customer_reviews.author: Janet S. Moughler

customer_reviews.title: My boy LOVES it!
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine gave me a box of this to try for my dog since he is older (12) and has trouble eating solid food. He LOVES it!!!! I have never seen him pick his dish up and carry it around, but with this food he started carrying his bowl to me. He is literally begging for it. The ingredients are high quality and the food actually smells delicious. My boy also had digestive issues and would get sick a lot. He has been very normal since starting this food.
customer_reviews.author: Jazmin Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Had my doubts but so far do good
customer_reviews.text: Every summertime my dog looses patches of hair. Was like that when I first rescued him I been feeding him Kirkland's chicken formular. Had to switch from a grain free to one with grains due to slightly enlarge heart. Since o started feeding him this on may 27th, the hair he was starting to loose has grown back, that had not happened before until October. He loves it although he has always been good about eating his food. The other fog in the house(not mine) who is a very pickey eater, goes crazy for it when I make it for my dog. Been in it for less than a month and will update in anouther month or so .
customer_reviews.author: Kalib

customer_reviews.title: One of the best dog foods.
customer_reviews.text: My son told me about this brand. He just started to feed it to his two dogs. Searched on line for reviews and ratings and came up as high ratings every time. Vet and dog groomer have also raved about this brand. Finished a 2 lb box and ordered this 4 lb, will last us a little while, and will continue to buy it. My Maltipoo loves it. She anxiously waits for me to put it in her bowl, and within seconds its gone. I try to buy everything Organic for myself, and in turn try to buy the very best for her, because I want her to be with me a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: sas

customer_reviews.title: Like paste. awful!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs except for one, would not touch this stuff, and the one that did had the runs for 3 days. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Dog likes it
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using Honest Kitchen Force for at least 20 years and have found it to be a healthy diet for my shelties. Used to make my own concoction but this is so much easier to use. Keegan did not like the base mixture at all but loves the chicken and turkey.
customer_reviews.author: shallcan

customer_reviews.title: This product changed my dogs life
customer_reviews.text: Seven year old Swiss mountain dog. She nearly died of an enlarged spleen/benign tumor. Once it was removed, we switched to honest kitchen dried foods. Beforehand, she was given a high quality holistic kibble food. Not saying it had anything to do with the tumor, but the honest kitchen food is clearly superior. It's been almost two years now and our nearly 9 year old dog is doing wonderfully. She has the energy of a 3 year old dog and looks amazing. Everyone comments how young she looks and acts, and I can only attribute it to the surgery and this food. She never turns it down!
customer_reviews.author: bmor

customer_reviews.title: No Killer Fillers: my pups love it!
customer_reviews.text: Day 1... pups would not touch it. Day 2... added a bit of minced chicken (2 tbsp). The pups loved it. Day 3... mixed a bit with their canned chow. Pups tolerated it. 2 weeks later, they LOVE this food! Plus, my overweight pup (9yr old pap) has shed a bit of weight and seems more perky lately. Most processed pet foods are like feeding your best friend dollar menu items from fast food restaurants... killer fillers! This one is different.
customer_reviews.author: Cj

customer_reviews.title: This is great dog food
customer_reviews.text: This is great dog food. It doesn't smell terrible like the canned food and my dogs eat it up like crazy. My older dog vomits up most foods and didn't eat much prior. For this she sits near me preparing it crying (she didn't do that before) and then eats it all in one sitting immediately. No throwing up, shes gained some weight FINALLY (shes underweight). I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: getaway18

customer_reviews.title: Our boxer loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Our boxer has an esophagus issues and can't keep kibble down. So a gruel food was our option. It is expensive - but good quality. We bix the chicken without grain (small box) with the big box of chicken with grain. Grain free is BAD unless your dog has a diagnosed allergy!
customer_reviews.author: BRS.56

customer_reviews.title: Not For English Bulldogs
customer_reviews.text: Fed this to my english bulldog for 3 months and then switched to home cooked meals about a month ago. Boy, I see a huge difference. When he was on this honest kitchen food, he just lacked energy. Slept all day and pooped very very frequently. At first I figured he just needs more protein, so I started adding cooked beef and chicken to his HK food but made no difference. Once I switched to home cooked meals like simple rice, carrot and meat, instantly I noticed more energy and alertness in him and lot less potty time which made it easy for me. So I wouldn't recommend Honest Kitchen to bulldog owners at least.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best dog food
customer_reviews.text: Best real human grade food for dogs for this price range. Shelf stable, unlike other human grade fresh foods on the market. All I can say is my dog loves it (he likes it thinner than recommended; so I add more water). If you really want “real” food for your dog this is it. Go read the definitions of chicken or fish meal or byproduct meal and you’ll never feed your dog kibble ever again. More expensive but it’s well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: todd m young

customer_reviews.title: Best dog food ever!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love it! Brought it with us when we evacuated for hurricane, easy to make and transport in a ziplock. Went to homemade food and was worried about nutrition so add this to their daily food but can use alone. One of the dogs lost most of his teeth so this works well for him too. One 10# box makes 40# of food. Put in bowl .. add water , mix and let set fit a few minutes the dogs act like they have never eaten before.
customer_reviews.author: SandyK1614

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth It
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I expected this to be better. The ingredients aren't that amazing, but I was willing to give it a shot. Both dry and rehydrated, the contents look and smell similar to oatmeal. The bag it comes in isn't resealable. My dog wouldn't eat it unless it was mixed with other food. This is the first time she has refused any brand. I rotate her food regularly.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Not solid at all in a flour grain form. No real taste for my dog
customer_reviews.text: It seems to have all the needed natural food ingredients but it’s a powder and you can’t really feed your doggie it without water unless you give it with wet food. Wish it came in patties shapes for the price of this grainy powder and stuff. He don’t really like it. Even after mixing it with wet food he seems hesitant and I tried its consistency different ways. I finally added egg and water and fried it into a patty then he ate it finally. Lots of mush effort just so he can eat it. Hmm. 🤨
customer_reviews.author: florjessa

customer_reviews.title: Great for picky dogs
customer_reviews.text: We have two Australian Shepherds and a rescue German Shepherd. My Aussies will eat anything but the German Shepherd is very, VERY picky. We used to use the honest kitchen for all our dogs and I’m so glad I thought of it when our dog wouldn’t eat. She devours the Honest Kitchen! My Aussies are very thankful for the yummy topper I’m adding to their dry food! I can’t say enough about this food.
customer_reviews.author: CarolinaRN

customer_reviews.title: The best dog food my pup has ever had.
customer_reviews.text: My Yorkie, is a very picky eater usually after about 1/3 of the bag of food she’s lost interest. I’ve tried other foods from Origen, Stella and chewies, primal, Merrick, and more. Now the honest kitchen she devours that thing like treats. Not only does she love the food but I noticed an improvement in her coat, has more energy which I feed her more for her to be more active. When I took her for her annual after her being on this food even the vet commented how beautiful her coat was coming in.
customer_reviews.author: Mariana Githens

customer_reviews.title: They will love you forever and ever!
customer_reviews.text: My greyhounds ADORE this food! Something changed with the brand that I had been feeding and both my girls were getting sick. Someone recommended this to me so I gave it a shot. In 24 hours their tummy troubles were gone (greyhounds are notorious for digestion issues). I kept them on this food alone for a bit while I was searching for a new dry kibble that works for them. Now I mix 1/3 cup of this dehydrated food with a cup of warm water, stir it up and wait 3 minutes, then I add a cup of dry kibble and mix it in. I've got it on auto-ship now so they never miss it. A++
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Great food!
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 dogs. One is very picky. Two out of 3 gobble it in less than 3 minutes. My tan Maltipoo is the picky one. Occasionally he will skip a meal, but he always eats it eventually. Smells good, and you can control the water intake, which is a big plus for me. My dogs rarely drink water. This way I can ensure they get enough water. I have been feeding them The Honest Kitchen for 3 years now.
customer_reviews.author: D. G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Dog Food
customer_reviews.text: Our dog loves this food! We’ve tried many different brands of food and supplements only to be disappointed to discover that our dog doesn’t care for it. We’ve also had to endure a shedding problem that was driving us crazy. Our finicky dog loved this food immediately and now eats with gusto. Her shedding problem has also been fixed. I highly recommend this dog food for everyone. 👍👍👍
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Not a hit for my dogs
customer_reviews.text: My dogs do not like this food. And, who knows why. The food came well packaged and mixes easily. The consistency is good and no obvious issues But, they walk away from this mixture. Maybe the texture or consistency. Who knows? They don't tell me. But, not a hit in this house. There are lots of good reviews....but not from these tail waggers.
customer_reviews.author: HomerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Beware worst case of Diarrhea ever!
customer_reviews.text: Gave my 9 year old chocolate English 65lb Labrador retriever terrible diarrhea, he had to be let out every hour all night long after feeding a mix of 1/3 cup of Natural Kitchen & 1/2 cup of the grain free kibble she had been eating happily for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart L. Maws

customer_reviews.title: 3 month old puppy likes it
customer_reviews.text: Well using it as a topper over kibble for 2 adult dogs and a young pup.The adult dogs seem indifferent,they eat it tho one spit it out.My puppy consumes it very heartily. I don't expect it will last more than a couple of weeks and it is pricey. I also use canned food which is cheaper..The ingredients seem really good quality which is why I wanted to try it.May buy it again..
customer_reviews.author: Leisa  in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: No teeth or little space when traveling
customer_reviews.text: This dog food is strange you add water and if he comes like baby food or gruel my dog ate it with no problems lick the platter clean if your dog is missing teeth I'd say this is perfect I go camping and trying to bring large bags of dog food takes up room this is perfect small box lots of food
customer_reviews.author: NANCY

customer_reviews.title: So easy!! Dogs approve too
customer_reviews.text: All 3 of my dogs loved it!! Easy to make and no smell.. I have looking for something like it because I was cooking their foods and it was always cold now I can give them fresh warm food .. I just make a cup of food and 1 1/2 warm water and divid it.. they only eat once aday so I might increase it depends on how they feel today .. great product thanks a million
customer_reviews.author: C. Kerner

customer_reviews.title: My dog wouldn’t even try it
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know about flavor, as I didn’t taste it! It smells horrible, though and my dog wouldn’t even stay in the same room with it!
customer_reviews.author: Suzie

customer_reviews.title: Great for persnickety dogs!!!
customer_reviews.text: We love feeding this to our dog! It seriously smells good enough to eat. He’s usually too eager to eat that he won’t wait for everything to rehydrate. The food gets very thick if it’s not eaten immediately, so we just add more water to it. Our dog prefers when we add about 2.5 times the water to whatever amount of food we use. He’s older and is missing most of his teeth.
customer_reviews.author: J. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: She kept everything down but the pieces of dehydrated meat...
customer_reviews.text: I really was hoping that my dogs would like this product. Instead, she threw up the pieces of dehydrated meat and kept everything else down... which I thought was odd. I also don't think she liked that it was pretty much a mushy consistency. Normally she would scarf down her kibble with whatever topped I had with it. She only ate half of her bowl and left the rest there. That was after we went on a hike and she was [retty damn hungry... It just wasn't appetizing and her stomach didn't want to process it.
customer_reviews.author: Shaberry

customer_reviews.title: ... I was using simply became more expensive than I like, and I'm very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Just started using this with our pups about 4 months ago when the brand I was using simply became more expensive than I like, and I'm very pleased. I saw others report about it being too soupy? I moisten our pups with bone broth (Also an Honest Kitchen product, if I don't do the homemade variety), and I only add for the consistency I desire...pretty much oatmeal-like. My pups love oatmeal, too, so this works well for them. I've been impressed with all the Honest Kitchen products I've been using so far.
customer_reviews.author: J Wolfy62

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff, worth the extra money
customer_reviews.text: Started using this because my dog was having constant UTIs, and I wanted to find a way to cut down on kibble in her diet while also infusing more liquid into her daily routine. This has been a really good addition. My dog loves it (actually goes crazy whenever I'm preparing it) and it gives me peace of mind knowing the ingredients are better for her. The stuff looks has a nasty oatmeal consistency when prepared correctly and is kinda stinky but again the dog loves it. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Davidoff

customer_reviews.title: Good mixed or alone. Great for backpacking.
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a picky eater. She is a 25lb rescue, border collie mix who has never been food incentivized. She really seems to like this food! I got it to supplement her diet or to take with us on backpacking trips. At home, I'll take about half a cup and mix it with warm water until it's an oatmeal consistency and mix it with her regular food. Either alone or mixed she usually cleans her dish!
customer_reviews.author: dana

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this food
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these! She would hardly eat dry food since she got a little older, so I tried these. Now she can’t wait to eat every day. They are a little expensive, but I feel like she is getting a better food and eating regularly so for me that’s worth it!i also haven’t noticed any allergies since she has been on this food which she did have in the past with some other foods
customer_reviews.author: MemphisM

customer_reviews.title: Your dog is your best friend feed them well.
customer_reviews.text: Can't say much for the flavor but my dog likes the beef best. I personally wouldn't know. Quality food and natural ingredients. I get the one with grain and the kibble without grain. She also likes their cookies. My dog eats good. Cheap dog food is like us eating all processed food. You get what you pay for. Honest kitchen is really good for your dog.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Copenhagen

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good food to mix with my puppies kibble so he ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a heeler puppy mix he is about 11 months old now. He was always hungry on kibble even when I mixed it with some of the dehydrated toppers. I started adding 1/4 cup of the Honest Kitchen Whole Grain Chicken to his kibble and he isn't hungry anymore. He gets excited and eats his food well starting with THK and then his kibble. My older dog was a street dog and he refuses to eat anything healthy so I am not surprised that he won't eat any of THK food. Overall a good food to mix with my puppies kibble so he isn't hungry and is getting healthy food.
customer_reviews.author: TinaP

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love the quality of this food. Our dog has the most sensitive stomach ever and he is allergic to poultry. So this food is great for him. He has no issues with it at all. We used to raw feed him but had to stop and this is as close as it gets to the raw food diet. We are very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: C. Martina

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: My dog has been on Sojo’s for a long time and thought we would try Honest Kitchen out. My 11 pound Yorkie started having overall itchiness and losing hair on his back!! He’s only been on it for 2 weeks and I’m taking him off of it and going back to Sojo’s.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My boys tails wag non-stop while eating!
customer_reviews.text: My two boys absolutely love this food. It just makes me smile to see their tails wagging while they devour the food. I mix it with their dry dog food to cut the cost and they love it.
customer_reviews.author: cmc

customer_reviews.title: I have happy pups!
customer_reviews.text: My mini Aussie is almost 12 and is OBSESSED with this food! She has always had a healthy appetite, but she gets extra pumped for mealtime now. As a side note, we recently got a puppy and my mini REFUSES to share a water bowl with him (diva times ten), and I love that I can add more water to this food to ensure she's plenty hydrated and she's still just as happy to lap it up. My puppy also prefers his meals to have HK sprinkled on top and mixed in. I'm a convert!
customer_reviews.author: APG

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love this stuff, but it's really overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs go absolutely crazy for The Honest Kitchen Whole Grain Chicken dog food. I've never seen them like a dog food so much. That being said, this stuff is really overpriced. It's $59 for just 10 pounds of food. Oh sure, they claim it makes 40 lb of food, but that additional 30lb is just water weight. If you added that much water to most dry kibbles priced around $60 per bag you'd get about 120 pounds of food.
customer_reviews.author: WZ

customer_reviews.title: My dogs likes it
customer_reviews.text: I am writing this on behalf of my dog...as I have not personally tasted it 😀. He likes it and we have been trying the different “meats”. A tad more expensive than your traditional dry food, but I believe I have seen a transformation in his demeanor, energy and metabolism. He cannot wait for that 3 minute timer to go off when the food is ready and dehydrated....talk about Pavlov’s dogs even if my name is not Pavlov.😃
customer_reviews.author: BEpilobium

customer_reviews.title: , Great Company!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this stuff. I add it to dry kibble for my picky eaters and also will thin it out and stuff kongs and hollow sterile bones and freeze for longer lasting treats. It's also easier to pack for trips and camping as it takes up less space and just needs water for reconstitution. I bought too much (extra box) by accident and they refunded me without requiring return so I will donate to local shelter. Amazing company to work with. So much cheaper here than in my local stores.
customer_reviews.author: Rhoda

customer_reviews.title: It's a green thick POWDER and not chicken bits.
customer_reviews.text: This is a thick green POWDER! It's like mushy baby food. The other dehydrated chicken I've purchased was nice chunks. My dog looked at it like I was crazy! Why pulverize the chicken?
customer_reviews.author: JeanDucksfan

customer_reviews.title: Best Decision I have ever made for my Dogs Health
customer_reviews.text: Started my dog on this brand about 6 months ago and he is now 10 going on 7. I cant say 100% that its totally the dog food but I know this food is much better than what I was giving him and he seems more energetic, the coat is shinner and he plays like hes seven years old again. He loves this food too always begging for more. So worth the little extra money it cost for such a loved pet. Tip, make sure you stir the water well so you get more out of it. I use a mixer.
customer_reviews.author: DavidA

customer_reviews.title: My Dogs Love It
customer_reviews.text: My two dogs are huge fans of this food! I put it on top of their dry food in the morning (I give them 1/2 the amount of dry food when they get honest kitchen too), and they eat it up! We have been using it for months and months. I have subscribed to the monthly order. I use about 3 cups of hot water, and 2- 2/12 cups of the mixture (for both dogs combined), and they get it for breakfast on top of 1 cup of dry food. My dogs are 100 lbs and 60 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: The best for the toothless
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I think this the best dog food ever! I literally just finished giving it to my dog and had to write this review immediately. I bought this preemptively as I was adopting a dog with no teeth and I researched what food to give them. This dog gobbled the food down and kept licking the bowl. The dog was excited about his other food, but not nearly so. He does not even know what treats are, so to see him react that way to his normal food is exciting. I also know he is getting the best ingredients. Even though it is more pricey, it is simply the best.
customer_reviews.author: Elmo

customer_reviews.title: Appears they changed to a finer grind
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this brand dog food for a long time and have been happy with it. But, the last box I bought has a different texture. It's more like peanut butter now and my dog doesn't want to eat it anymore. The mix is more powdery than before and my dogs poo has gotten loose and he doesn't want to eat it now. Sadly I'll be switching to a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Gadgets

customer_reviews.title: Made my dog sick (read other 1 star reviews)
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: company has excellent customer service over email. They apologized that my dog got sick and are sending me a refund check. My advice is to thoroughly read reviews and research pros and cons of dehydrated food methods/regulatory procedures for stating "human-grade". Read reviews, dogs have had bad reactions to this (including mine).
customer_reviews.author: Melissa T.

product_meta.title: The Honest Kitchen Human Grade Dehydrated Organic Whole Grain Dog Food
product_meta.description:
Flavor Name:Chicken| Size:10 lb (makes 40 lbs)ABOUT WHOLE GRAIN CHICKEN DOG FOOD RECIPE
For hounds, and humans, on a budget. Whole Grain Chicken Recipe for dogs is a hearty recipe for the picky, the pregnant and the puppy-alike. With free-range chicken, simple garden produce and organic whole grain barley, each bite is unbelievably tasty (this we know, because we taste it all ourselves).
The Honest Kitchen Whole Grain Chicken Recipe is a dehydrated dog food that is AAFCO complete and balanced for all life stages and breeds. It is higher in protein and fat than other Honest Kitchen recipes so it's perfect for puppies and active adult dogs. It's a hearty recipe with quality ingredients at a lower price, perfect for hounds on a budget! It's also one of our most palatable recipes and is perfect for picky dogs.
feature_bullets: FREE RANGE CHICKEN & ORGANIC WHOLE GRAINS: The Honest Kitchen Whole Grain Chicken dog food is made with real whole food ingredients like free range chicken, organic oats, carrots & bananas, which are gently dehydrated for maximum nutrient retention and easy digestion.
SUPER TASTY & HIGH PROTEIN: This recipe is packed with human grade, free range chicken for an irresistible taste.

ALL NATURAL & MADE IN THE USA: This natural dog food is made with ingredients you’d recognize from your own kitchen with uncompromising quality standards. We never use: artificial preservatives, by-products, fillers, GMO ingredients, corn, wheat or soy.

HUMAN GRADE: The Honest Kitchen is made with 100% human grade ingredients and is produced in a human food facility. That means higher quality ingredients and more safety standards, just like you'd expect in your own food.
INSTANT HOMEMADE: Just add water for a warm for a fresh & delicious meal. Serve alone as a complete meal for maximum nutrition, or use as a topper to their dry food.
SUITABLE FOR PUPPIES & ADULT DOGS: Complete & Balanced nutrition for dogs of all life stages, breeds and sizes including adults, puppies and gestation.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
